customer:
Ask the customer to record a video or picture and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)
Check if the condenser fan blade is hitting any foreign objects.
technician:
Check if noise outside:
1.Check if the fan motor is defective.
2.Check whether there is any noise caused by loose screws.
3.Inspect the compressor for abnormal noise.
(There is a metal fastening strap on top of the compressor, which is used to protect the compressor during transportation. It is recommended to remove it and continue observing, as the noise may be caused by resonance)

Check if noise inside:
1.Check if the evaporator fan is hitting the banding strap

customer:
Ask the customer to record a video or picture and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)

Check the drain hose for loose drains inside?
(The customer may have accidentally detached the drain hose while storing items.)

Drain Hose Clogged?
(Scale build up is the most likely cause of leaking within the unit. If customer is comfrotable this sort of issue is fixable over the phone by explaining how to remove and clean the drain pipe)

Check if the door gasket is damaged?
(A damaged door gasket can allow external air to enter the cabinet, leading to excessive moisture buildup

Is there any hot equipment placed next to the refrigerator?
(The temperature and heat from nearby hot products can directly affect the refrigerator's surface or cause excess moisture inside. This is a normal occurrence, unless the customer keeps the hot equipment far away from the refrigerator.）
technician:
Please confirm the above five points with the technician:
1.record a video or picture and send it to us for analysis.
2.Check the drain hose for loose drains inside?
3.Drain Hose Clogged?
4.Check if the door gasket is damaged?
5.Is there any hot equipment placed next to the refrigerator?.

customer:
asking the customer to record a picture and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)

Is there condensation on the outer surfaces of the refrigerator on both sides?
(Please confirm whether the distance between the two unites is too close,It is recommended to maintain a distance of 10-15 cm between each refrigerator.)
technician:
Is there a water leak at the air pressure balancing valve?
(The previous old design had a water leakage issue. Sending the latest parts will resolve this problem.)

customer:
asking the customer to record a picture and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)
technician:
Check if the power supply is working.
()

Check if the Led is working.
(If the LED Lighting connector is getting voltage and the light is still not coming on, then the LED light is faulty.)

customer:
asking the customer to record a picture and send it to us for analysis.
(Make sure to upload it into the system)

If it is clearly a transportation damage issue caused by the customer during handling
(we will only send parts to the customer, not dispatch a technician)
technician:
If the caster is broken,technician will need to replace it onsite
(Remember to send the casters along with the nuts when shipping the accessories!)

customer:
Confirm with the customer which icons are displayed on the screen.
(The icons indicate that the corresponding components are functioning Basic Unit Functions)

Is the condenser fan working?
①.If not, check if the fan blade is obstructed by any foreign objects.
②.If it’s not obstructed but still not working, the fan needs to be replaced

Check if the internal evaporator fan is working?
If only one fan is not working, replace the faulty fan.

Check if the condenser is dirty or clogged?
If the customer is unsure, ask them to take a photo and send it for confirmation
technician:
Check if the evaporator is frozen?
1.Test if probes are working properly,cooler doesn't have defrost probe(Different temperatures show different OHM values; please refer to this parameter Test probe).
2. Check if the evaporator fan is working? (Confirm if there is a 115V voltage output. Evaporator fan maintenance manual)
3.Ensure that the refrigerator temperature setting is not lower than 35℉

Check if the compressor is working properly?
1.Check if the compressor resistance is normal Compressor Resistance Check Video )
2.If the start component is faulty, it is recommended that the technician try using a 3n'1 start kit 3n'1 Operating Instructions)

All parts are functioning properly. Please check if there is a refrigerant leak.
1.Recommend the technician to test the low-side; the normal low pressure should be 44-46 PSI,please refer to this parameter Pressure temperature Chart)
 2.Check for leakage points, prioritizing the areas marked in black. Each machine has this label near the compressor.Refrigerant Circuit Diagram
3.If the tech needs us to provide capillary tube fittings,Please let the tech know we recommend cut 2-3 inches of the end cap tube and blow the whole system by nitrogen and then replace a new universal filter drier, vacuum and recharge the unit

customer:
The unit is completely non-functional?
(Check if the display and condenser fan are completely non-functional,Please replace the power outlet and try again to ensure there is power in the outlet.)

Please ask the customer to check if the power cord is damaged?
(If there is any damage, please take a photo and send it to us. We will send part and dispatch tech to repair it.)
technician:
If the unit has no power:
1.Check if the controller wiring harness is properly connected and ensure there are no loose connections.
2.Check if the Power Switch is faulty

customer:
Dixell Parameters:
P1:Room Probe Failure(White Proe)or Loose Wiring on the controler
P2:This unit doesn't have a defrost probe. Please calibrate the parameters first (Check the P2 parameter to see if it's set to 'n')or replace the control board.
P3&P4:Bad controller
dA:Door open long time or door magnetic switches issue.
It is recommended to verify all the parameters based on the parameter table in the document section
Confirm whether the wiring is correct(Please refer to the wiring method of Dixell on the Page 1 of 7)
technician:
Carel Parameters: Atosa Carel Refrigerator parameters
EO: Probe 1 (White Probe) Failed or Disconnected. Code shows when probe is disconnected.
El: Probe 2 Failed or Disconnected. Code shows when probe is disconnected. If unit is a refrigerator change d0 parameter to 2
OF: Hold down the power button for 3sec Operation video
Do: Door Open Alarm. Verify A4 parameter is set to 6 and check the magnet door switch wiring Do Code Solution
EE&EF: Unit Parameter Error. Replace Controller.
ED: Defrost Ended by Timeout. Possible P2 Probe Failure or Defrost Solenoid Issue.
DF: Unit is in Defros
It is recommended to verify all the parameters based on the parameter table in the document section
Confirm whether the wiring is correct(Please refer to the wiring method of Dixell on the Page 1 of 7)
